title: Piers Morgan warned California wildfire near his home 'will get worse'
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Piers Morgan received a dire warning from Good Morning Britain amid the devastating wildfires in California.

Piers is currently in the US during his break from the show, and has been sharing updates from his location in Los Angeles..

Susanna explained on Tuesday’s show: ‘The Getty Museum is just three miles away from where he is.’

She then shared his social media update, a picture of warning alerts he had been getting as the ‘horrific’ fire spread.

Weather reporter Laura Tobin was on hand to explain how the wildfire got started and what people in the area can expect over the coming days – and Piers needs to brace himself.

Laura explained: ‘It is the fact that it’s been so dry. Some places haven’t seen rain since May and some areas have seen temperatures over 100 Celsius since the end of July.

‘There are 17 fires in total burning across California. This one here, the Kincade, is the biggest one. It has tripled in size since Sunday. It’s bigger than the area of Birmingham and can be hundreds of miles from space.

Piers has been in America as he takes a break from Good Morning Britain (Picture: Instagram)

She went on: ‘It is down to a Santa Ana wind, a hot, dry wind that comes from the interior, 60mph gusts of winds mean it will spread very quickly.

‘Conditions should improve by Thursday or Friday but for now it is looking pretty horrific, and unfortunately it’s only going to get worse.’

Laura explained the ‘hot, dry winds’ were causing the fires to spread quickly (Picture: ITV)

In an Instagram post, Piers shared: ‘Yikes. Rather discomforting msgs to wake up to.. the Getty museum is just 3 miles away.

‘These fires are horrific, hard to explain to people back home how big and savage they get here in California, and how fast the changing winds can take them in completely different directions.’

Along with his message was an image of a text alert advising people to ‘prepare to evacuate’.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays from 6am on ITV.
